citation.article-title: Paraprevotella clara gen. nov., sp. nov. and Paraprevotella xylaniphila sp. nov., members of the family ‘Prevotellaceae’ isolated from human faeces
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Paraprevotella (Pa.ra.pre.vo.tel′la. Gr. prep. para beside, next to; N.L. fem. n. Prevotella name of a bacterial genus; N.L. fem. n. Paraprevotella a genus similar to Prevotella).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming and non-motile.
Utilize various sugars and produce succinic and acetic acids as major fermentation end products.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, anteiso C15 : 0 and C18 : 1ω9c.
The major respiratory quinones are MK-10(H0) and MK-11(H0).
The type species is Paraprevotella clara.
